content: a few notes this is a versitile square that can be used to make a variety of items such as blankets bags pillow covers and more it can be used traditionally as joined equal sized squares or as one large continuous square uust keep adding more rounds until it reaches the size you need when worked continuoiusly this pattern does not create the vortex twist that sometimes happens with other crochet patterns like continuous granny squares so no need to flip your work over between rounds i created 2 large squares and joined them together to make a pillow cover see my video for that here or check out my youtube channel pattern and craft this pattern also includes an optional variation to the pattern for rounded corners which is useful for making items like pillow covers pin cushions and bags etc the rounded corners do not lay flat so they are only recommended for items that have volume for flat items such as blankets i recommend sticking with the regular square corners of the basic pattern difficu it� level easy materials yarn of your choice i used made with love the cottony one lion brand crochet hook that matches your yarn i used a 5 5mm hook tapestry needle for sewing in ends yarn color your choice i used lychee white yarn quantit� this will vary by what size project you are making for the 16 x 16 pillow cover i used 283g which is about 525yd/480m which is a little less than 3 balls of the made with love the cottony one yarn 1 oog per ball 1 © 2024 courtne\ mcfarland
